string-array.name: version_changelog
string-array.item: Add support for multiple watches!
Find the new Watch Manager in App Settings, where you can add and remove watches, as well as set a nickname for any watch
Do not Disturb Sync should now work on phones running Android 5.0 to 5.1, if you have a phone running either version please send feedback about your experience
Device charge notifications now show the name of the device that\'s charged
Battery Stats widget is back! This is a very \'first step\' kind of implementation just to get it working with the new multi-watch system
Removed the sync button from the Battery Sync activity, it wasn't working with the current implementation of battery sync
App Manager UI tweaks
Loading screens now use a horizontal loading bar
Significant code and performance optimisations for the mobile app, more on the way
Code optimisations for the watch app
The usual dependency updates

string-array.name: interrupt_filter_sync_to_watch_steps
string-array.item: On your computer, make sure you have access to ADB. If you don\'t, you\'ll need to install ADB from https://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=2317790

Enable ADB on your watch. This can be done by navigating to Settings -> System -> About, then tapping \'Build number\' until developer mode is enabled. Then, from Settings, navigate to \'Developer Options\'. Scroll down and enable \'ADB Debugging\'. If your watch doesn\'t support USB data transfer, you\'ll need to enable \'Debug over Wi-Fi\' as well
Connect your watch to your computer, either by USB (if your watch supports it) or via Wi-Fi (You\'ll need to run \'adb connect\' followed by your watch IP address)

Run the following command: adb shell settings put secure enabled_notification_listeners com.google.android.wearable.app/com.google.android.clockwork.stream.NotificationCollectorService:com.boswelja.devicemanager/com.boswelja.devicemanager.dndsync.DnDLocalChangeService
Tap \'Next\'
